title: STEVE MARRIOTT - ASTORIA MEMORIAL CONCERT OF STEVE MARRIOTT
description:
STEVE MARRIOTT (born.January 30, 1947 died.April 20, 1991 R.I.P.)

Can't believe that No one has reviewed this excellent tribute footage from 2001 
to the Nr 1 RockÃ‚Â´n Roll icon Steve Marriott who passed away in a house fire in 1991. Amoung those
in attendance and contributing:

High Lights:
Paul Weller and Noel Gallagher: Tin Soldier
Steve Ellis who sounds alot like Marriott doing "Afterglow" with the Mods
"Here Come the Nice" with Kenny Jones, Ian McLagan, Paul Weller
Reformed Humble Pie running through "Shine On", "Four Day Creep" among many other
Pie numbers.


On 20th april 2001, a great cast of musicians paid tribute to the great Rocker,
The little white dude with the black manÃ‚Â´s deep soulfull voice,
Steve could sing the roof off any house with his unique and one of a kind voice
.HeÃ‚Â´s.a true legend, Steve Marriott upon the 10th anniversary of his tragic death.
In this Memorial Concert. all former members in the legendary "Supergroup"Humble Pie"
performing, together with "Small Faces" members and from the group "Packet Of Three"watching
Greg Ridley hitting those great bass licks is a real treat, together with Peter Framton
and Dave "Clem" Clempson, Jerry Shirley and with SteveÃ‚Â´s son Toby singing 30 days
In The Hole, wow! That must have put a big smile on SteveÃ‚Â´s face;) and also his daughter Molly 
singing, and Deborah Bonham + Houseband...  
This is the whole show,on DVD some legendary stuff here.. enjoy it dudes.. 
there will NEVER!! be another Steve Marriott!!!!!
